subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|庚|口|c1=p|c2=s|t2=mouth|ls=psc}} – to exaggerate, to boast. {{lang|zh|唐}} and {{zh-l|*庚}} were near-homophones in Old Chinese.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Either related to {{och-l|途}} (Wang Li, 1982) or from {{der|zh|aav}}, compare {{cog|mkh-pro|*glɔɔŋ}}, whence {{cog|mnw|ဂၠံၚ်}}, {{cog|kns|gəlɔŋ}}, {{cog|kdt|khlù:aŋ}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}})
